content.raw:
Looks good to me. Just one more comment from reading the rules:

    If an initial report was deemed invalid due to insufficient accuracy or incorrect type, a team may 
    submit another report, which will be scored using the same scoring metric. Such a scenario may  
    arise, for example, when an initial report is not accurate but further exploration (e.g., loop closure, 
    averaged  readings)  results  in  a  more  accurate  estimate  of  type  or  location.  Duplicate  reports,  
    whether valid or invalid, are subject to the limitations described in Section 11.3. 

Our current `ScoreArtifact()` function removes the artifact checked for scoring from the list of potential artifacts. This is expected when the report is correct but I think we should keep it as a potential artifact if the report is incorrect \(type or accuracy\). This way,  a team can submit a new report from the same artifact and our scoring function will grant the extra point.
content.html:
Looks good to me. Just one more comment from reading the rules:

If an initial report was deemed invalid due to insufficient accuracy or incorrect type, a team may 
submit another report, which will be scored using the same scoring metric. Such a scenario may  
arise, for example, when an initial report is not accurate but further exploration (e.g., loop closure, 
averaged  readings)  results  in  a  more  accurate  estimate  of  type  or  location.  Duplicate  reports,  
whether valid or invalid, are subject to the limitations described in Section 11.3.

Our current ScoreArtifact() function removes the artifact checked for scoring from the list of potential artifacts. This is expected when the report is correct but I think we should keep it as a potential artifact if the report is incorrect (type or accuracy). This way, a team can submit a new report from the same artifact and our scoring function will grant the extra point.
